ai-vb7:1.1_0: The four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
ai-vb7:2.1_0: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of the body internally?
ai-vb7:2.2_0: It’s when a mendicant examines their own body up from the soles of the feet and down from the tips of the hairs, wrapped in skin and full of many kinds of filth.
ai-vb7:2.3_0: “In this body there is head hair, body hair, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, bones, bone marrow, kidneys, heart, liver, diaphragm, spleen, lungs, intestines, mesentery, undigested food, feces, bile, phlegm, pus, blood, sweat, fat, tears, grease, saliva, snot, synovial fluid, urine.”
ai-vb7:2.4_0: But they develop and cultivate, and make much of that foundation; and a bride.
ai-vb7:2.5_0: Having developed and cultivated that foundation, they arranged and develop it externally.
ai-vb7:3.1_0: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of the body externally?
ai-vb7:3.2_0: It’s when a monk above the soles of the feet and down from the tips of the hairs, wrapped in skin and full of many kinds of filth.
ai-vb7:3.3_0: “In this body there is head hair, body hair, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, bones, bone marrow, kidneys, heart, liver, diaphragm, spleen, lungs, intestines, mesentery, undigested food, feces, bile, phlegm, pus, blood, sweat, fat, tears, grease, saliva, snot, synovial fluid, urine.”
ai-vb7:3.4_0: But they develop and cultivate, and make much of that foundation; and a bride.
ai-vb7:3.5_0: Having developed and cultivated that foundation, they arranged their mind and develop it before collecting the body.
ai-vb7:4.1_0: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of the body internally?
ai-vb7:4.2_0: It’s when a monk above the soles of the feet and down from the tips of the hairs, wrapped in skin and full of many kinds of filth.
ai-vb7:4.3_0: “In this body there is head hair, body hair, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, bones, bone marrow, kidneys, heart, liver, diaphragm, spleen, lungs, intestines, mesentery, undigested food, feces, bile, phlegm, pus, blood, sweat, fat, tears, grease, saliva, snot, synovial fluid, urine.”
ai-vb7:4.4_0: Then they meditate observing an aspect of the body internally and externally—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

ai-vb7:22.1_0: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of principles internally?
ai-vb7:22.2_0: When they have sensual desire in them, they understand: ‘I have sensual desire in me.’ When they don’t have sensual desire in them, they understand: ‘I don’t have sensual desire in me.’ They understand how sensual desire arises; how, when it’s already arisen, it’s given up; and how, once it’s given up, it doesn’t arise again in the future.
ai-vb7:22.6_0: When they have doubt in them, they understand: ‘I have doubt in me.’ When they don’t have doubt in them, they understand: ‘I don’t have doubt in me.’ They understand how doubt arises; how, when it’s already arisen, it’s given up; and how, once it’s given up, it doesn’t arise again in the future.
ai-vb7:23.1_0: When they have mindfulness of the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity arise, and if they’ve already arisen, they understand that.
ai-vb7:23.6_0: When they have equanimity in them, they understand: ‘I have equanimity in me.’ When they don’t have equanimity in them, they understand: ‘I don’t have equanimity in me.’ They understand how equanimity arises; how, when it’s already arisen, it’s given up; and how, once it’s given up, it doesn’t arise again in the awakening factors of equanimity.
ai-vb7:23.7_0: But they develop and cultivate, and make much of that foundation; and a bride.
ai-vb7:23.8_0: Having developed and cultivated that foundation, they arrange it and develop it externally.
ai-vb7:24.1_0: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of principles externally?
ai-vb7:24.2_0: It’s when a monk who has sensual desire in them understands: “I have sensual desire in them, when they don’t have sensual desire in them, they understand: ‘I don’t have sensual desire in me.’ They understand how sensual desire arises; how, when it’s already arisen, it’s given up; and how, once it’s given up, it doesn’t arise again in the future.
ai-vb7:24.6_0: When they have doubt in them, they understand: ‘I have doubt in doubt; when they don’t have doubt in them, they understand: ‘I don’t have doubt in me.’ They understand how doubt arises; how, when it’s already arisen, it’s given up; and how, once it’s given up, it doesn’t arise again in the future.
ai-vb7:25.1_0: When they have the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity arise, and if they’ve already arisen, they understand that.
ai-vb7:25.8_0: But they develop and cultivate, and make much of that foundation; and a bride.
ai-vb7:25.9_0: Having developed and cultivated that foundation, they arrange it and develop it for theocuse.
ai-vb7:26.1_0: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of principles internally?
ai-vb7:26.2_0: It’s when a monk who has sensual desire, ill will, dullness and drowsiness, restlessness, and remorse, and doubt; how, when they’re given up sensual desire, they understand how sensual desire arises; how, when it’s already arisen, it’s given up; and how, once it’s given up, it doesn’t arise again in the future.
ai-vb7:26.6_0: When they have doubt in them, they understand: ‘I have doubt in me.’ When they don’t have doubt in them, they understand: ‘I don’t have doubt in me.’ They understand how doubt arises; how, when it’s already arisen, it’s given up; and how, once it’s given up, it doesn’t arise again in the future.
ai-vb7:27.1_0: When they have mindfulness of the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity arise, and if they’ve already arisen, they understand that.

ai-vb7:35.2_0: A mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body,
ai-vb7:36.1_0: And how does a mendicant meditate observing an aspect of the body?
ai-vb7:36.2_0: A time comes when a mendicant develops the supreme state of immersion, honored, respected, esteemed, and venerated. ...
ai-vb7:36.2_1: At that time they enter and remain in the first absorption, when they meditate with equanimity, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.
ai-vb7:36.3_0: This is called the eight mindfulness of the body.
ai-vb7:36.4_0: the rest of their mindfulness meditation.
